page.title: 02West Farnham's Old Buildings
page.content: {West Street}contains many buildings dating back to before the 19th Century. The best known are : {Vernon House},now the library, is an interesting historical building.Back in 1648 Charles 1, soon to be executed stayed overnight in Farnham with his captors. The blind Henry Vernon was chosen as host because he would be unable to arrange an escape. Charles gave his gold night cap to Henry in way of his gratitude. {Wilmer House}was probably built in 1718 and now houses Farnham museum. It has a fine Georgian staircase only found in four other houses in Farnham. Architecturally this house is one of the finest examples in Farnham. Its brickwork demonstrates a fine local craftsmanship at its best. Many interesting lanes lead off West Street e.g.Fox Yard, Potter's Gate.
